abstract: Some critics say drug maker Shire is going too far in its marketing of Vyvanse, amphetamine-based drug that was recently approved to treat binge-eating disorder; Shire spent years before approval shaping public perception and diagnosis of binge-eating disorder, much as it did with ADHD in the past; controversy highlights marketing strategy that has yielded billions in profits and that many say presents public danger.
lead_paragraph: The strategy for a new drug to treat binge-eating disorder reveals how a pharmaceutical company can influence the treatment of a medical condition.

headline.main: Shire, Maker of Binge-Eating Drug Vyvanse, First Marketed the Disease
headline.print_headline: Maker of a Drug to Treat Binge-Eating Marketed the Disease First

snippet: The strategy for a new drug to treat binge-eating disorder reveals how a pharmaceutical company can influence the treatment of a medical condition.
